TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IEnlistmentNotification

summary.span: 描述一个接口，资源管理器应实现该接口以在登记参与时为事务管理器提供两阶段提交通知回调。

span.span: Describes an interface that a resource manager should implement to provide two phase commit notification callbacks for the transaction manager upon enlisting for participation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 为了使资源管理器以参与事务，它必须通过事务管理器在事务中登记。In order for a resource manager to participate in a transaction, it must enlist in the transaction through the transaction manager. 类定义了一组提供此功能的方法，这些方法的名称以 `Enlist` 开头。The class defines a set of methods whose names begin with `Enlist` that provide this functionality. 不同`Enlist`方法对应于不同类型的资源管理器可能具有的登记。The different `Enlist` methods correspond to the different types of enlistment that a resource maanger may have. 此类描述资源管理器应实现以在登记参与时事务管理器提供两阶段提交通知回调的接口。This class describes an interface that a resource manager should implement to provide two phase commit notification callbacks for the transaction manager upon enlisting for participation. 有关每个资源管理器的实现接口，则应使用其在登记方法或方法的类，具体取决于所需的资源是可变或持久性。For each resource manager's implementation of the interface, you should enlist it using the method or the method of the class, depending on whether your resource is volatile or durable. 登记和 2PC 的更多信息，请参阅[登记为参与者在事务中的资源](~/docs/framework/data/transactions/enlisting-resources-as-participants-in-a-transaction.md)并[单阶段和多阶段中提交事务](~/docs/framework/data/transactions/committing-a-transaction-in-single-phase-and-multi-phase.md)分别。For more information on enlistment and 2PC, see [Enlisting Resources as Participants in a Transaction](~/docs/framework/data/transactions/enlisting-resources-as-participants-in-a-transaction.md) and [Committing a Transaction in Single-Phase and Multi-Phase](~/docs/framework/data/transactions/committing-a-transaction-in-single-phase-and-multi-phase.md) respectively. 通过以下方法中，事务管理器会在两阶段提交协议的不同阶段通知登记的对象。The transaction manager notifies the enlisted object at different phases of the Two Phase Commit Protocol by the following methods. |方法Method|描述Description| |------------|-----------------| ||事务管理器将询问参与者它们是否能够提交该事务时，此方法登记的对象由事务管理器的事务，在第一个阶段中用作回调。This method of an enlisted object is used as a callback by the Transaction Manager during the first phase of a transaction, when the transaction manager asks participants whether they can commit the transaction.| ||如果该事务被提交，此方法登记的对象由事务管理器在事务的第二个阶段中用作回调。This method of an enlisted object is used as a callback by the Transaction Manager during the second phase of a transaction if the transaction is commited.| ||如果该事务被中止 （即，回滚），此方法登记的对象由事务管理器在事务的第二个阶段中用作回调。This method of an enlisted object is used as a callback by the Transaction Manager during the second phase of a transaction if the transaction is aborted (that is, rolled back).| ||如果事务不确定，此方法登记的对象由事务管理器在事务的第二个阶段中用作回调。This method of an enlisted object is used as a callback by the Transaction Manager during the second phase of a transaction if the transaction is in doubt.| > [!NOTE] > 您应注意，按顺序，或按特定顺序可能不会发送通知。You should be aware that notifications might not be sent sequentially, or in a particular order. ## Examples 下面的示例显示了此接口，以及该对象登记在事务中使用的参与者为实现方法。The following example shows an implementation of this interface, as well as enlisting the object as a participant in a transaction using the method. [!code-csharp[Tx_Enlist#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/tx_enlist/cs/enlist.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Tx_Enlist#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/tx_enlist/vb/enlist.vb#1)]

related.span: 在事务中将资源登记为参与者

span.span: Enlisting Resources as Participants in a Transaction

related.span: 在单阶段和多阶段中提交事务

span.span: Committing a Transaction in Single-Phase and Multi-Phase

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Commit(class System.Transactions.Enlistment enlistment) cil managed

param.name: enlistment
param.span: 用于将响应发送到事务管理器的 对象。

span.span: An object used to send a response to the transaction manager.

summary.span: 通知登记的对象事务正在提交。

span.span: Notifies an enlisted object that a transaction is being committed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 时指示所有参与者提交事务，事务管理器做出的承诺，在第二个阶段调用此方法的登记的对象。The transaction manager calls this method of an enlisted object during the second phase of a commitment, when it instructs all participants to commit the transaction. 资源管理器应执行任何工作需要完成交易记录，并随后告知它已完成通过调用 TM方法`enlistment`参数。The resource manager should perform any work necessary to finish the transaction and then inform the TM that it has finished by calling the method on the `enlistment` parameter. 如果资源管理器已持久登记，但不响应通过调用方法中，事务管理器不能确定资源管理器已接收调用。If the resource manager has enlisted durably, but does not respond by calling method, the transaction manager is unsure that the resource manager has received the call. 在这种情况下，事务管理器将继续等待响应，并维护与此事务相关的信息。As such, the transaction manager keeps waiting for a response, and maintains information relevant to this transaction. 如果是永远不会调用，这条信息是围绕无限期保留在内存中或在系统范围资源。If is never called, this piece of information is kept around indefinitely in memory or in a system-wide resource. 这会导致无法回收资源。This results in resources not being able to be reclaimed. 在分布式事务的情况下这可能最终填满 MSDTC 日志将停止 MSDTC 过程。In the case of a distributed transaction, this could eventually fill the MSDTC log which halts the MSDTC process. 在管理的事务的情况下，这会导致在资源管理器的进程的内存使用情况的逐步地持续增长。In the case of a transaction managed by , this results in a gradual and continual increase in the memory consumption of the resource manager's process. 因此，很重要，则调用方法一旦资源管理器通过您准备工作。Therefore, it is crucial that you call the method once your resource manager is done with your prepare work.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void InDoubt(class System.Transactions.Enlistment enlistment) cil managed

param.name: enlistment
param.span: 用于将响应发送到事务管理器的 对象。

span.span: An object used to send a response to the transaction manager.

summary.span: 通知登记的对象事务的状态不确定。

span.span: Notifies an enlisted object that the status of a transaction is in doubt.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当事务管理器调用到单个持久资源，单阶段提交操作，然后与持久资源的连接丢失之前得到事务结果，易失性资源调用此方法。This method is called for volatile resources when the transaction manager has invoked a single phase commit operation to a single durable resource, and then connection to the durable resource was lost prior to getting the transaction result. 此时，不能安全地确定事务结果。At that point, the transaction outcome cannot be safely determined. 作为被视为一个事务的最终状态，不应调用或后调用。As is considered to be a final state for a transaction, you should not call or after calling . > [!NOTE] > 此方法对于易失性资源的实现应在受影响的数据执行它了解任何恢复或封锁操作。Your implementation of this method for the volatile resource should perform whatever recovery or containment operation it understands on the affected data. 它还必须调用上的方法上`enlistment`完成其工作时的参数。It must also call the method on the on the `enlistment` parameter when it has finished its work. 如果资源管理器已持久登记，但不响应通过调用方法中，事务管理器不能确定资源管理器已接收调用。If the resource manager has enlisted durably, but does not respond by calling method, the transaction manager is unsure that the resource manager has received the call. 在这种情况下，事务管理器将继续等待响应，并维护与此事务相关的信息。As such, the transaction manager keeps waiting for a response, and maintains information relevant to this transaction. 如果是永远不会调用，这条信息是围绕无限期保留在内存中或在系统范围资源。If is never called, this piece of information is kept around indefinitely in memory or in a system-wide resource. 这会导致无法回收资源。This results in resources not being able to be reclaimed. 在分布式事务的情况下这可能最终填满 MSDTC 日志将停止 MSDTC 过程。In the case of a distributed transaction, this could eventually fill the MSDTC log which halts the MSDTC process. 在管理的事务的情况下，这会导致在资源管理器的进程的内存使用情况的逐步地持续增长。In the case of a transaction managed by , this results in a gradual and continual increase in the memory consumption of the resource manager's process. 因此，很重要，则调用方法一旦资源管理器通过您准备工作。Therefore, it is crucial that you call the method once your resource manager is done with your prepare work.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Prepare(class System.Transactions.PreparingEnlistment preparingEnlistment) cil managed

param.name: preparingEnlistment
param.span: 用于将响应发送到事务管理器的 对象。

span.span: A object used to send a response to the transaction manager.

summary.span: 通知登记的对象事务正在为提交做准备。

span.span: Notifies an enlisted object that a transaction is being prepared for commitment.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事务管理器时调用此方法的已登记的资源管理器在阶段 1 的承诺，它会要求参与者它们是否能够提交该事务。The transaction manager calls this method of an enlisted resource manager during the phase 1 of a commitment, when it asks participants whether they can commit the transaction. 在实现持久资源管理器时，应记录你在此阶段的准备记录。When you are implementing a durable resource manager, you should log your prepare record during this phase. 记录应包含所有必要的信息来执行恢复。The record should contain all the necessary information to perform recovery. 这包括属性，用于传递给事务管理器中在恢复过程的方法。This includes the property, which is passed to the transaction manager in the method during recovery. 有关恢复的详细信息，请参阅[Performing Recovery](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d342c5c7-da64-4a4c-8e63-b52f4fbf2691)。For more information on recovery, see [Performing Recovery](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/d342c5c7-da64-4a4c-8e63-b52f4fbf2691). 资源管理器应完成所有工作，必须完成后再调用方法的`preparingEnlistment`参数以指示承诺对其投票。Your resource manager should complete all work that must be finished before calling the method of the `preparingEnlistment` parameter to indicate its vote for commitment. 应确保这一点在提交、 回滚或置疑接收任何第 2 阶段通知此类之前。You should make sure that this is accomplished before receiving any phase 2 notification such as commit, rollback or in doubt. 这是因为第 2 阶段通知可以发生在调用的同一线程上内联在第 1 阶段的方法。This is because phase 2 notifications can happen inline on the same thread that called the method in phase 1. 因此，在调用 后，您不应执行任何预计在收到第 2 阶段通知前就可完成的操作（如释放锁定）。As such, you should not do any work after the call (for example, releasing locks) that you would expect to have completed before receiving the phase 2 notifications. 您还可以调用的方法`preparingEnlistment`参数来指示回滚一票。You can also call the method of the `preparingEnlistment` parameter to indicate a vote for rollback. 如果你想要只是观察并做出响应的事务，进度的对象不参与它，此方法的实现应调用方法的`preparingEnlistment`完成其工作时的参数。If you want the object to merely observe and react to the progress of the transaction, without participating in it, your implementation of this method should call the method of the `preparingEnlistment` parameter when it has finished its work. 通过这样做，资源管理器将不会收到任何第 2 阶段通知。By doing so, your resource manager would not receive any phase 2 notification.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Rollback(class System.Transactions.Enlistment enlistment) cil managed

param.name: enlistment
param.span: 用于将响应发送到事务管理器的 对象。

span.span: A object used to send a response to the transaction manager.

summary.span: 通知登记的对象事务正在回滚（中止）。

span.span: Notifies an enlisted object that a transaction is being rolled back (aborted).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当事务正在回滚 （中止），因为一个或多个事务参与者无法提交事务时，事务管理器将调用此方法的登记的对象。The transaction manager calls this method of an enlisted object when the transaction is being rolled back (aborted) due to the inability of one or more transaction participants to commit the transaction. 资源管理器应执行任何工作需要完成交易记录，并随后告知它已完成通过调用 TM方法`enlistment`参数。The resource manager should perform any work necessary to finish the transaction and then inform the TM that it has finished by calling the method on the `enlistment` parameter. 如果资源管理器已持久登记，但不响应通过调用方法中，事务管理器不能确定资源管理器已接收调用。If the resource manager has enlisted durably, but does not respond by calling method, the transaction manager is unsure that the resource manager has received the call. 在这种情况下，事务管理器将继续等待响应，并维护与此事务相关的信息。As such, the transaction manager keeps waiting for a response, and maintains information relevant to this transaction. 如果是永远不会调用，这条信息是围绕无限期保留在内存中或在系统范围资源。If is never called, this piece of information is kept around indefinitely in memory or in a system-wide resource. 这会导致无法回收资源。This results in resources not being able to be reclaimed. 在分布式事务的情况下这可能最终填满 MSDTC 日志将停止 MSDTC 过程。In the case of a distributed transaction, this could eventually fill the MSDTC log which halts the MSDTC process. 在管理的事务的情况下，这会导致在资源管理器的进程的内存使用情况的逐步地持续增长。In the case of a transaction managed by , this results in a gradual and continual increase in the memory consumption of the resource manager's process. 因此，很重要，则调用方法一旦资源管理器通过您准备工作。Therefore, it is crucial that you call the method once your resource manager is done with your prepare work.
